title: 2019 Ukrainian presidential election - Wikipedia
snippet: Presidential elections were held in Ukraine on 31 March 2019. As none of the 39 candidates on the ballot received an absolute majority of the initial vote, a runoff was held on 21 April between the top two vote-getters: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, a television personality, and Petro Poroshenko, the ...

title: Next Ukrainian presidential election - Wikipedia
snippet: On 9 December 2025, after pressure from US President Donald Trump to hold elections, Zelenskyy said he was ready to hold elections in 60 to 90 days if the US and Ukraine's European allies ensured the necessary security.

title: Zelenskyy ‘ready for elections’ after Trump questions Ukrainian democracy | Ukraine | The Guardian
snippet: Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said he is ready to hold a wartime election within the next three months, if Ukraine’s parliament and foreign allies will allow it, after Donald Trump accused him of clinging on to power.

title: Russia-Ukraine Live: Trump Gives Zelensky New Deadline On Peace Plan—Report - Newsweek

title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy - Wikipedia
snippet: Zelenskyy's term was originally scheduled to end in May 2024, but the ongoing Russian invasion and the resulting ongoing martial law prevented the regularly scheduled presidential election from being conducted.
